main event: Two separate observations of a star-like object in the sky over Yellowstone National Park and Big Fork, Montana, were reported on August 30 and September 8, 1966.
interesting points: The object maintained a steady brightness and color during both observations., One observer described the object as looking like a very bright star, while another noted it as elongated and cigar-shaped., Both sightings lasted for a few minutes with no apparent sound., There was a sense of urgency in the reports due to the suggestive nature of UFO sightings., Observers raised concerns about the Air Force's handling and investigation of UFO sightings over the years.
sighted object: A star-like object that appeared bright and steady.
location: Big Fork and Yellowstone National Park, Montana, USA
witness description: Various civilians including an instructor with a Ph.D. and his sister.
